@exps35 wrote:

I’ve been making loads of updates to it after testing it a few times. I’m about 90% done with letting you do all of your A and D baits before using all of your F baits.

I was contemplating whether or not to put it up. The less people with it, the more likely that they won’t add another button to stop autoing.

But Oh well. Here it is:

item.title: I need help clicking a "OK" button
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

before every click, make an If then else statement?
If findbitmap old guy then //not bothering with coord.s
findbitmap BottomBorder
Mouse(x -i, y +30)
else
SelectBait

Is that possible? I haven’t been scripting for even a week yet, so I’m just throwing out ideas here.[br][size=1]Posted on: May 21, 2007, 06:06:49 PM[/size][hr]I have a working version of the script now.

I just made the script look for that old guy, thenMoveMouse(x+120,y+140);

then i Just kept repeating a GetMousePos, and ClickMouse at x-25,y
Until Not findbitmaptolerancein etc.

item.source: I need help clicking a "OK" button

item.title: I need help clicking a "OK" button
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

It doesn’t matter. Nobody will actually care if its in the wrong section or not.

And to better explain what I meant, put into the script:

findbitmap(x, y, border, x1,y1,x2,y2)
Mouse(x-i, y+30)

and set ‘i’ to a variable that starts at a negative number (say -300), and make it go up by 20 at every repeat. Do the repeat until ‘i’ is then 300, So it has searched and clicked everywhere on that horizontal line.

And hopefully that won’t start clicking baits that you don’t want.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help clicking a "OK" button
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I think what hes trying to say is that the border is always the same.
You can get a bitmap for the bottom border, make SCAR find that bitmap, and then make it click every pixel along the horizontal row, which is 30 pixels above the bitmap.

You might want to check that the border is the same though…

Read full topic

item.title: I need help clicking a "OK" button
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Gaia Fisher Revamped…lol
I used that script for quite a while a few months ago, and got myself quite a bit of gold. The only thing that bothered me was that I had to click okay after every load. I sucked at scripting then (I still do) and couldnt be bothered with trying to fix it

Read full topic
item.source: I need help clicking a "OK" button

item.title: I need help clicking a "OK" button
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“gokon, post:2, topic:96362”]theres this amazing thing called “making more than one bitmap”
and if that doesn’t work because Gaia online changes its colors a tiny bit like runescape, theres this other amazing thing called “tolerance”[/quote]

Trust me, it doesn’t work. High tolerance won’t work and neither does bitmap masks, I don’t know why so don’t ask me.

newguy45, I suggest finding out of the outside of the menu(the branch bits) change color, if not, I suggest finding the top right corner and clicking every pixel roughly 30 down until you’ve clicked ok.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help clicking a "OK" button
item.dc:creator: @newguy45 newguy45
item.description:
@newguy45 wrote:

i made the revamped gaia online fishing script and now its ruined because the game was updated with really complex “ok” buttens that move around the screen and change color

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//                              -GaiaOnline-                                  //
//                              -Auto Fisher-                                 //
//                               -Revamped-                                   //
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
//                         -Script By JingleBits-                             //
//                         -revamped by newguy45-                             //
//          ....................................................              //
//       -Credit to Immafatmess for dealing with my ranting thanks man-        //
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
//                              -whats new-                                   //
//          ....................................................              //
//                   -Newly added SelectRod procedure-                        //
//                        -Minor color adjustments-                           //
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
//                               -instructions-                               //
//          ....................................................              //
//                  -Drag the crosshair onto the fishing screen-              //
//                   -Set the bait type to eather A,D, or F.                  //
//                       -Set the rod choice to eather-                       //
//                             -p for proformance-                            //
//                           -p+ for Proformance plus-                        //
//                                 -b for bacic-                              //
//                              -b+ for basic plus-                           //
//                                -d for distance-                            //
//                             -d+ for distance plus-                         //
//                                -s for strangth-                            //
//                            -s+ for strangth plus-                          //
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

program GiaFish;
var Hours,Minutes,RealMins,Seconds,RealSecs,
    x,y,c,d,z,z2,x2,x3,xmin,xmax,Fish,Bait,
    L,R,P,Q:integer;
    StartTime:LongInt;
    TotalTime,TotalTime2:string;
const
Click=0;// dont fuck with this
BaitType='F';//A for Grade A. D for Grade D. F for Grade F
RodChoice='b';//p,b,d,s,p+,b+,d+,s+,b+

procedure SelectRod;
Begin
If(RodChoice='b')Then
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,26367,601,445,631,471))then
repeat
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(500);
until(GetColor(541, 386)=5731482);
end;
If(RodChoice='b+')Then
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,26367,601,445,631,471))then
repeat
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(500);
until(GetColor(541, 386)=5731482);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;
If(RodChoice='d')Then
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,26367,601,445,631,471))then
repeat
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(500);
until(GetColor(551, 397)=9402461);
end;
If(RodChoice='d+')Then
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,26367,601,445,631,471))then
repeat
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(500);
until(GetColor(551, 397)=9402461);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;
If(RodChoice='s')Then
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,26367,601,445,631,471))then
repeat
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(500);
until(GetColor(526, 369)=4997255);
end;
If(RodChoice='s+')Then
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,26367,601,445,631,471))then
repeat
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(500);
until(GetColor(526, 369)=4997255);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;
If(RodChoice='p')Then
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,26367,601,445,631,471))then
repeat
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(500);
until(GetColor(533, 362)=7445074);
end;
If(RodChoice='p+')Then
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,26367,601,445,631,471))then
repeat
clickmouse(x,y,true);
wait(500);
until(GetColor(533, 362)=7445074);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;
wait(2000);
end;

procedure Cast;
begin
if(Not(GetColor(485, 371)=13033719))Then
begin
c:=0;
If(Getcolor(254,450)=12370107)Then
begin
repeat
Clickmouse(270,315,true);
c:=c+1;
until(c>Click-1);
end;
c:=0;
repeat
wait(10)
c:=c+1;
until(GetColor(414,450)=3813571)or(c>390)
c:=0;
repeat
Clickmouse(270,315,true);
c:=c+1;
until(c>Click);
c:=0;
end;
end;

Procedure SelectBait;
Begin
If(GetColor(313, 215)=16777215)Then
Begin
Bait:=Bait+1;
If(BaitType='A')Then
begin
repeat
ClickMouse(370,278,True);
c:=c+1;
until(c>Click);
end;
If(BaitType='D')Then
begin
repeat
ClickMouse(450,278,True);
c:=c+1;
until(c>Click);
end;
If(BaitType='F')Then
begin
repeat
ClickMouse(526, 267,True);
c:=c+1;
until(c>Click);
end;
Wait(3000)
end;
end;

Procedure FirstBait;
Begin
If(GetColor(313, 215)=16777215)Then
Begin
Bait:=Bait+1;
If(BaitType='A')Then
begin
repeat
ClickMouse(370,278,True);
c:=c+1;
until(c>Click);
end;
If(BaitType='D')Then
begin
repeat
ClickMouse(450,278,True);
c:=c+1;
until(c>Click);
end;
If(BaitType='F')Then
begin
repeat
ClickMouse(526, 267,True);
c:=c+1;
until(c>Click);
end;
Wait(3000)
end;
end;

procedure KeepTime;
begin
 Seconds:=(GetSystemTime-StartTime) div 1000;
 Minutes:=Seconds div 60;
 Hours:=Minutes div 60;
 if(not(Minutes=0))then
  RealSecs:=Seconds mod (Minutes*60);
 if(not(Hours=0))then
 begin
  RealSecs:=Seconds mod (Minutes*60);
  RealMins:=Minutes mod (Hours*60);
 end;
 if(Minutes=0)then
  if(Seconds<10)then
   TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':0'+inttostr(Minutes)+':0'+inttostr(Seconds)) else
   TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':0'+inttostr(Minutes)+':'+inttostr(Seconds));
 if(Hours=0)then
 begin
  if(not(Minutes=0))then
  begin
   if(Minutes<10)then
   begin
    if(RealSecs<10)then
     TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':0'+inttostr(Minutes)+':0'+inttostr(RealSecs)) else
     TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':0'+inttostr(Minutes)+':'+inttostr(RealSecs));
    end else
    begin
     if(RealSecs<10)then
      TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':'+inttostr(Minutes)+':0'+inttostr(RealSecs)) else
      TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':'+inttostr(Minutes)+':'+inttostr(RealSecs));
    end;
   end;
  end;
 if(not(Hours=0))then
 begin
  if(RealMins<10)then
  begin
   if(RealSecs<10)then
    TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':0'+inttostr(RealMins)+':0'+inttostr(RealSecs)) else
    TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':0'+inttostr(RealMins)+':'+inttostr(RealSecs));
  end else
  begin
   if(RealSecs<10)then
    TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':'+inttostr(RealMins)+':0'+inttostr(RealSecs)) else
    TotalTime:=(inttostr(Hours)+':'+inttostr(RealMins)+':'+inttostr(RealSecs));
  end;
 end;
end;

procedure report;
begin
KeepTime;
If(Not(TotalTime=TotalTime2))then
begin
TotalTime2:=TotalTime;
ClearReport;
Addtoreport('We have been working for '+TotalTime+'.');
Addtoreport('We have caught '+inttostr(Fish)+' fish,');
Addtoreport('and have used '+inttostr(Bait)+' bait.');
end;
end;

procedure FindSpeed;
begin
z2:=GetSystemTime;
If(z2-z>500)Then
begin
z:=GetSystemTime;
If(x2>x3)Then
begin
d:=x2-x3;
end;
If(x3>x2)Then
begin
d:=x3-x2;
end;
findcolor(x3,y,0,325,291,436,417);
findcolortolerance(x3,y,526351,325,291,436,417,10);
findcolortolerance(x3,y,16768971,325,291,436,417,10);
findcolortolerance(x3,y,1118495,325,291,436,417,50);
end;
end;

procedure CatchFish;
begin
repeat
{332 for preformance rod. 323 for plus}
if(findcolor(x,y,0,325,291,436,417))or(findcolortolerance(x,y,526351,325,291,436,417,10))or(findcolortolerance(x,y,16768971,325,291,436,417,10))or(findcolortolerance(x,y,1118495,325,291,436,417,50))Then
Begin
x2:=x;
if(x2<xmin)Then
begin
xmin:=x2;
end;
if(x2>xmax)Then
begin
xmax:=x2;
end;
findcolor(c,y,26367,260,203,273,400)
FindSpeed;
if(y<384)Then
begin
status('x is at '+Inttostr(x2)+'. Lowest = '+inttostr(xmin)+'. Highest = '+inttostr(xmax)+'. Arrow = '+inttostr(y)+'. Left= '+inttostr(L)+'. Right= '+inttostr(R)+'. Speed = '+Inttostr(d)+' P/s.');
end;
If(x<380)Then
begin
movemouse(595,415);
R:=R+1;
end;
If(x>380)Then
begin
movemouse(200,415);
L:=L+1;
end;
wait(20)                                                                                                                     {^^originals}                                                                                                        {^^originals}
End
Else
Begin
If(x2<380)or(x2=380)Then
begin
movemouse(592,415);
end;
If(x2>380)Then
Begin
movemouse(200,415);
end;
//clearreport;
//AddtoReport('Color of Lost Spot = '+inttostr(Getcolor(x,y)));
end;
report;
until(GetColor(254,450)=12370107)or(GetColor(521,277)=2699176)
R:=0;
L:=0;
c:=0;
z:=0;
z2:=0;
xmax:=0;
xmin:=600;
end;

procedure Talk;
begin
q:=q+1;
If(Q>150)Then
begin
q:=0;
Clickmouse(532,566,true);
SendKeys('hi guys');
SendKeys(chr(13));
wait(200);
SendKeys('zzzz');
SendKeys(chr(13))
wait(100);
SendKeys('damn cans');
SendKeys(chr(13))
wait(100);
SendKeys('oi! *slap* ure scareing the fish away');
SendKeys(chr(13))
end;
end;

begin
ChangeReportWidth(285)
Status('Looking For Client Window')
repeat
wait(2000)
until(FindWindowBySize(641,581))
FindWindowBySize(641,581);
ActivateClient;
wait(2000)
starttime:=getsystemtime;
xmin:=600;
FirstBait;
SelectRod;
repeat
report;
SelectBait;
//Talk; uncomment if you want to but i think its crap
Cast;
P:=P+1;
repeat
wait(100)
status('~Waiting To Fish~ ~Fish~ ~Waiting To Fish~ '+inttostr(p))
report;
findcolor(x,y,26367,260,203,273,400)
until(GetColor(440,198)=2086904)or(y>390)
If(y>200)and(y<390)and(GetColor(440,198)=2086904)Then
begin
status('FISHING! FISHING! FISHING! FISHING! FISHING! FISHING! FISHING! FISHING!')
wait(1000)
CatchFish;
Fish:=Fish+1;
P:=0;
end;
wait(400)
until(false)
end.

now i need a way to click the ok buttens and i dont know how i can with out useing a bitmap which relies on color. Here are a few pics of the ok buttens

please let me know if anyone has an idea of how to click the butten







[br][size=1]Posted on: May 17, 2007, 09:30:27 AM[/size][hr]Dose no one know how i may do this?

Read full topic
item.source: I need help clicking a "OK" button
